intro: Sloanea guapilensis, commonly known as the Guapil tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
